result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Wulff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brian D Wulff
Current: W8796 Cty Rd M, Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2016)
Prior: 2176 1st. Drive, Westfield, WI 53964

Defendant Brian D Wulff in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF58, 13CM150, 13TR1805, 13TR1933, 14CF10 & 14CF26:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was approved for Treatment Court.
Atty Hendee states that this is charged as a 7th offense; however, there are 2 motions pending for collateral attack.  Per the agreement, the defense will be withdrawing one of those motions for collateral attack.  Based on that the State files an amended information; amending Ct. 1 to OWI - 6th offense.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 13CF58, Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in & Ct. 3 to be dismissed.  Ct. 1 in 14CF10 and Ct. 1 in 14CF26, Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  13CM150 to be dismissed and read-in.  Traffic matters to be dismissed.
Atty Frank agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to all cases.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Court questions the defendant regarding Treatment Court.  Defendant agrees and is looking forward to the Treatment Court Program.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 13CF58, Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in & Ct. 3 to be dismissed.  Ct. 1 in 14CF10.
Court approves the DPA with conditions on Ct. 1 in 14CF26, Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  
13CM150 to be dismissed and read-in.  
Traffic matters to be dismissed.

Atty Frank withdraws one of the collateral attack motions.
BY THE COURT:  One of the collateral attack motions is withdrawn

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to go along with the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  TREATMENT COURT:
13CF58:  Amended Ct. 1, OWI - 6th offense: Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Report forthwith
*Good Time
*Credit = 4 days (if revoked)
*Pay fine and costs = $1,494.00
*DNA Sample (if not already been taken) + surcharge 
*36 months DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Participate and successfully complete the treatment court program
Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in
Ct. 3 to be dismissed.

14CF10:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*12 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; stayed
Report forthwith
*Credit = 3 days (if revoked)
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Surcharge
*Participate and successfully complete the treatment court program
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

14CF26:  Court approves the 24 month DPA with conditions.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in
Credit = 118 days (if revoked)

13CM150:  Dismissed and read-in

13TR1805 & 13TR1933 to be dismissed.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 17, 2014 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Brian D Wulff in court with attorney Ryan T Frank.  Defendant Brian D Wulff in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF58 - Motion
14CF10 & 14CF26 - Arraignment
Atty Hendee states that there is a motion for collateral attack on 13CF58.  Atty Hendee states that the treatment court team will hopefully be making a decision whether or not the defendant is accepted into Treatment Court tomorrow.  Atty Hendee states that the parties would prefer not to have the motion hearing today.  Atty Hendee is ok to go ahead with the Arraignment on the other two cases.
Atty Frank agrees but states that he does not feel it is necessary to go ahead with the Arraignments on 14CF10 & 14CF26.  Atty Frank states that there is also 13CM150 that should be tracking with.
Atty Hendee agrees.

BY THE COURT:  14CF26, 14CF10 & 13CM150 should track with 13CF58.
Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued in all matters  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian D Wulff
Current: 2176 1st. Drive, Westfield, WI 53964   (Effective: 04-24-2014)
Prior: 2176 1st Drive, Westfield, WI 53964 United States

Defendant Brian D Wulff in court with attorney Ryan T Frank.  Defendant Brian D Wulff in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF58, 14CF10 & 14CF26:
Atty Hendee states that a motion for collateral attack was filed on 13CF58 and the other two cases are set for Preliminary Hearings.  Atty Hendee states that the parties agreed that the Prelims would not go today due to the officer was not available today.  Parties are very close to resolution on all three cases.  Atty Hendee asks the court to set out the motion hearing on 13CF58 and both 14CF10 & 14CF26 would track with that case.
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussion on possible treatment court and asks that this be set out 30 - 40 days.   Atty Frank agrees.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset all three cases to track with 13CF58.

Atty Frank states that the defendant waives the Preliminary Hearing in 14CF10 & 14CF26. Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court for 14CF10 & 14CF26.
  Atty Frank states that the Defendant received a copy of the information for both cases & waives it's reading.  Arraignment scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF10 & 13CF58:

Atty Frank agrees and states that he will be filing that motion.

BY THE COURT:  Reset both hearings.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
letter from defendant regarding bail $ being returned asap to person posting. Court not making any guarantees on that request
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brian D Wulff in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Brian D Wulff in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frank states that his client will waive the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim.

Atty Frank asks that the bond be reduced.
Atty Hendee objects to the bond modification.
BY THE COURT:  Motion denied; bond will remain the same.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety
*Court will permit Law Enforcement to test the Defendant with a PBT at any given time.

Defendant Brian D Wulff in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant should have received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court questions the defendant.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is facing charges in other cases 13CF58 and 13CM150.
Court questions the defendant.  

Defendant's mother asks the court for house arrest.
Court denies the request for house arrest.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,500 cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety
*Court will permit Law Enforcement to test the Defendant with a PBT at any given time.

Court questions the defendant if he will have Atty Frank represent him on this case.
Defendant states that yes he would like Atty Frank.
BY THE COURT:  Court appoints Atty Frank.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
